website_summaries.verdict: Set of traction pads for off-road use in vehicles of all sizes.
pros: Large surface area can handle a variety of wheel and vehicle sizes without buckling or slipping in wet conditions
Tracks are light enough to carry around when necessary
cons: The larger traction pad bulk can be difficult to position correctly under trapped tires

customer_reviews.title: like an idiot (like me)
customer_reviews.text: I have a modified, big, heavy (7,000 lb) Land Cruiser and I have had these escaper buddies for a couple years now. I wheel a lot alone, in the Rocky Mountains, and when I get stuck, I rely on my gear to help me get out. These are an indispensable part of my recovery gear, along with my winch and hi-lift jack and tow ropes. These lil' guys help get you out of the deep stuff when nothing else will! Just be careful not to spin your tires on them, like an idiot (like me), and they will probably last a lot longer!
customer_reviews.author: gregweik

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Knock Offs
customer_reviews.text: These failed twice in 2 different situations... 2 different types of tires...once in sand, once in mud. The nubs just do not get any bite in the tire tread. They do nothing no matter how you try. Slow, fast, angled, straight, dug out or not. Eventually they will just melt from tire spin. You are better off building your own or buying the real Maxtrax.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Literally saved my life
customer_reviews.text: If you're on the fence, just do it. They are half the price of MaxTrax and just as good, I haven't used them as a bridge, but they literally saved my and my wife's lives in a recent Colorado Blizzard on a horrible mountain pass. Good tires, and 4LO couldn't get me up the 12% grade in about 1' of fresh snow on top of 1-2" of ice and we were just sliding sideways toward the literal cliff. We got these babies out, wedged them against the front and rear opposite corners and it got us out of the terrible situation and back home.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Best deal for the money
customer_reviews.text: I now have two sets of Maxsa Traction mats. The first have probably been used a dozen times - once as a bridge to get a one ton cargo van over a part of a dirt road that had caved in. I thought the mat would surely break but it survived with no problems. Given the performance and ruggedness I've experienced with these I would never buy a MaxTrax when Maxsa's are available at such a cheaper price. I would never go lower on price, either, from the cheap knockoffs now flooding the market. Maxsa's are a well-reviewed option to the MaxTrax's.
customer_reviews.author: Cort Johnson

customer_reviews.title: A must - fantastic
customer_reviews.text: These are a must for anyone going off road. I have been stuck twice, in sand and a crevice on a ridge. These mats got me right out. My grandson had a friend stuck in a muddy slough. Nothing worked, 4 wheel drive, winch. But when they worked the mats under the back wheels, the 4 wheel truck came right out. They couldn't believe it.
customer_reviews.author: Richard L. Baxter

customer_reviews.title: which allows them to slip easily in some situations
customer_reviews.text: Really thought these could work in place of some bigger name brands, but the lack of stackability is an issue for me and they also don't have any tread on the backside, which allows them to slip easily in some situations. They are better than having nothing for a recovery, but I think I'll end up having to buy the name brand eventually.
customer_reviews.author: Powers 4x4

customer_reviews.title: OMG!!! Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: I have a yard that dips low and the low part ALWAYS stays wet. I pretty much get my zero turn stuck at least every other time I try to cut my grass. In trying to get the zero turn out, we've gotten trucks stuck trying to get the zero turn out! Once, 2 pickups and the zero turn got stuck, and we had to use my husbands 18-wheeler to get the pickups out! What a mess. These simple little pieces of plastic work SO good. They're light, easy to carry to where you need them, and work like a charm. For real...if you have a similar situation in your yard, you'll want to get these.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Must have for 4x4s
customer_reviews.text: Maxtrax too expensive? I have 4 of these and wouldn't ever forget them. Let me add, you're not going to bridge with these. Nothing you can buy except metal bridges to load quads will do that. Use them as a shovel (if sand) and kick em hard if mud. Use them as they're intended you'll do just fine. They are made to bend to fill little dips and holes. Do not lay from flat on a square hole with your tire crushing it inward. Used about 50 times now and barely any of the nips have shortened. Do not spin your tires on them and they will last. I use a bike lock to keep vandals away. (Don't trust anyone)
customer_reviews.author: Matt Mallion

customer_reviews.title: Trail Benders Overland approved! 5 stars!!!
customer_reviews.text: Used in my recent trip to Zion... it was raining, I was going up the side of a hillside and slid down roads the edge, I gunned it hoping I would catch some traction and wouldn’t roll down, instead I buried myself to the frame. I used this great piece of gear and with no hesitation I got out of that sticky situation with this piece of gear! Thank you for a great product, reliable and lived up to the name! My YouTube channel is Trail Benders Overland, I did a review of this product as well as documented my whole Zion barracks trail expedition, check it out as the videos will be released shortly!
customer_reviews.author: Steven Koonce

customer_reviews.title: I've used them three times on other rigs; so ...
customer_reviews.text: I've used them three times on other rigs; so far they've held up well. (Sand/Snow) Time will tell as far as durability. Made for a much faster recovery than pulling out my winch. Opted to take the risk on a cheaper product as I do have other recovery means (winch, tow straps, other rigs etc)
customer_reviews.author: Usta

customer_reviews.title: cheap knockoff
customer_reviews.text: I originally posted a good (4 star) review of these, however, I used them again to get a couple rigs unstuck from snow at a trailhead (Land Cruiser and Grand Cherokee) and both of them broke. The Land Cruiser snapped one completely in half and the Jeep badly cracked the other one. The traction and flotation they provide is alright but they are not durable at all. This was only the 3rd or 4th time I used them and now they are both useless. I just ordered a pair of the real thing (Maxtrax) and I am hopeful they will hold up better. Bottom line, you get what you pay for, if you're a serious off-roader, buy the real thing.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Very very hard cheap plastic
customer_reviews.text: These work but they are already showing signs of stress. One knob broke off and there is a crack down one already and I've only used them two times. Very very cheap hard plastic.also quite thin. Not like the big name brand at all. I would buy another brand. My truck is very light, I can't imagine a bigger truck using these without them breaking. 2 stars because these things are going to break next time I use them and the warranty won't cover it.
customer_reviews.author: Dg3toyota

customer_reviews.title: Hold up well and work great!!
customer_reviews.text: These things are amazing!! We bought these for offroading in muddy areas and they have come in super handy a number of times already! Held up to at least a half dozen stuck jeeps and trucks with little sign of wear! we bought a set of x-bulls for a second vehicle and they are showing signs of exteme wear after just one use! trashing those blue ones and buying another set of Maxsa traxs!! only downside is they dont stack as nicely but thats ok considering how awesome they are for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Arrived damaged but Maxsa personally called me.
customer_reviews.text: They arrived damaged which initially made me think that they might not be as strong as I had hoped. I initially contacted Maxsa to complain and I left a bad review. The president of Maxsa personally got in touch with me to do whatever he could to make it right including sending me a brand new set if necessary. He also assured me that they must have been damaged in shipping and that they are indeed extremely durable. Fantastic customer service so far. I will test them out and if they perform as expected I will upgrade to 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Brando

customer_reviews.title: Would have gotten out without them
customer_reviews.text: Positives: I definitely wouldn’t have gotten out with out them. I was high centered and these made it so my tires could get grip. I learned that you need to take the time to place them right under the wheels or they are not going to work. Negatives: Some traction nubs melted off already and I have only used them Once. They don’t stack at all. They sit on top of one another which makes it harder to store. Cheaper than the max Trax tho.
customer_reviews.author: FRDM

customer_reviews.title: Ok, but not as good as the originals.
customer_reviews.text: Works ok, considering it's quite a bit cheaper than original MaxTrax. One essential difference, they don't lock to each other as the MaxTrax do. This is not only advantageous for taking less space when stacked; the MaxTrax that way are much stronger when stacked.
customer_reviews.author: jackyblack

customer_reviews.title: Great traction device offered at a much more reasonable price than another, popular brand.
customer_reviews.text: Great traction device offered at a much more reasonable price than another, popular brand. Outstanding quality. These will be great for beach trips in my F-450, dually, expedition camper, that I am not able to air-down the tires easily.
customer_reviews.author: Backnthaday

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I have had to use these once this winter, but they worked perfectly. I slid my plow truck off the side of the road the storm after a road grader had widened the road and was able to get out by placing 1 traction mat under the front tire on the road and 1 under the back tire that was still up on the road. I put the truck in low range and crawled my way back up on the road past the traction mats. Without them I don’t think any amount of shoveling would have allowed me to get back on the road alone without a tow from another truck or heavy equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Collier

customer_reviews.title: Ten minutes and i was out. Used my shovel ...
customer_reviews.text: Ten minutes and i was out. Used my shovel to dig out the tires, put the mats under and i was out.
customer_reviews.author: ryan

customer_reviews.title: Not the best material used...
customer_reviews.text: Updating my original review. I have had these for a couple of years now. Used them a few times. Today, I cracked one of them when getting unstuck from some marble sized gravel. Not too impressed. I suspect that my 1 Ton 4x4 is too heavy for this product. Look elsewhere if you have a heavier rig.
customer_reviews.author: Ally

customer_reviews.title: Not what they seem!
customer_reviews.text: Consider getting the real deal! Go with maxtrax and spend the extra cash! I used them one time and they cracked and have a ton of stress marks. They are warp and are very thick for storage!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Better as secondary traction board, but not for primary use.
customer_reviews.text: the design of the nubs do not provide any “bite”. I am a professional volunteer in off road recovery and have used them several times. Most of the time, they don’t work to get a vehicle out from being initially stuck. However, they are very sturdy and have been very useful for added traction once a stick vehicle is unstuck.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Results Not guaranteed....
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and well-made, but I couldn’t pull out of a snow bank with my truck leaning slightly to one side...! It failed me the first Tim with needed it. I had to put chains on in the snow while stuck......
customer_reviews.author: Walid

customer_reviews.title: Half the price of Maxtrax and worked like a charm on our trek through The Mojave Road ...
customer_reviews.text: Half the price of Maxtrax and worked like a charm on our trek through The Mojave Road the couple of times we needed the assist.
customer_reviews.author: Adventureswithdog

customer_reviews.title: Valuable traction mats that will get used for 4WD poor traction situations
customer_reviews.text: The MAXSA Escaper Buddy Traction Mats will get used when needed to get out of mud, loose sand, or snow situations. Mats are fairly lightweight but have good traction spikes on bottom and top. About 4' long so easy to carry. Nice to get out of difficult situations during 4WD touring.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: First impressions are great solid product
customer_reviews.text: First impressions are great solid product. They seem built well and the plastic is trimmed well and smooth where the molding seam is. I did expect the nodules/spikes to be sharper but i guess no worries about getting scratched up while using them. I haven't had the chance to use them yet but I will update this review when that times comes and add some pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Levi Houston

customer_reviews.title: Great for sand
customer_reviews.text: We have used these 4 times in the last two years to get out tow rigs stuck in sand. Two pickups pulling travel trailers and two RVs pulling cargo trailers. These work Awesome! One note though: in all 4 instances, the vehicles were not stuck to the frames, because the owners stopped driving as soon as the realized they were in trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie W

customer_reviews.title: A good lower-cost alternative.
customer_reviews.text: I used mine today in a snow recovery situation, and they worked quite well - with no damage to the recovery boards. As always, the key is good prep (digging them in properly) and taking your time (don't spin the tires). The only thing I don't like about them is that they don't stack well like more expensive options.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen M

customer_reviews.title: Ive tried them once in mud and if set up properly they work great. Cleaning from mud can be a pain but ...
customer_reviews.text: 4 stars for future update. Ive tried them once in mud and if set up properly they work great. Cleaning from mud can be a pain but worth the savings. When it comes to storage these do not sit flush with each other, like other brands so they may seem bulky for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Bryant De La Campa

customer_reviews.title: Easy to carry and pack
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic cheap get out of trouble traction alternative Great for mud, snow, wet grass. A lot cheaper than calling for a tow truck. Well built with reinforcements and studs.
customer_reviews.author: Tweakes182

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome product
customer_reviews.text: I have an OSV permit for my Jeep and purchased these traction boards to be used on the beach. This weekend they got used for the first time. A guy driving a Dulley pickup got buried to his frame in sand. Grabbed my boards and came to his rescue. We were able to get his heavy truck up and going without causing and damage to the traction boards. I would highly recommend this product to anyone
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: If you want to save some money.
customer_reviews.text: It's perfect for snow and sand so the average off roading. However the chemicals and compound don't compare to the real deal. If you are off roading hardcore, this may not be the best bet. However, they do work. I just wish they stacked.
customer_reviews.author: Razor Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Overall more bang for the buck! :-)
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the money. Other better ones out there but they cost 3x more so instead I bought 3x of these. Overall more bang for the buck.
customer_reviews.author: JZ

customer_reviews.title: Worked great and held up just fine.
customer_reviews.text: Finally had a chance to use these. Easily helped a neighbor get unstuck on his property in a 3/4 ton van pulling a little dump trailer half full of dirt. Worked and held up well.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Saavedra

customer_reviews.title: Must have for winter
customer_reviews.text: My wife had to use these when I was out of town and they both performed really well. A must have for your winter/off road kit. We will have to see how long they hold up over prolonged use and additional exposure to the elements. I would recommend these to anyone who likes to be prepared and is an essential piece of winter or off road equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Terrible! Do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: TERRIBLE. Used on AWD in mud. DID NOT WORK. Used with 2wd in sand. DID NOT WORK.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff S

customer_reviews.title: Great investment
customer_reviews.text: Why anybody would spend $300+ on maxtrax blows my mind these are amazing. These have supported the full weight of a Tacoma and Wrangler and not snapped under the weight. They just bend back to the original form. They have gotten me and my friends out of some tight spots. Not a better value for a product highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: They're pretty good, helped us recover from some puddles that ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought these because we were too cheap to get MAXTRAX. They're pretty good, helped us recover from some puddles that were.. oh, maybe 3 feet deeper than we thought.. as well as helped us get other people unstuck. We eventually bought a pair of MAXTRAX, but still use these MAXSA tracks in conjunction since they're still a big help. They're slightly larger than the MAXTRAX as well, if you need bigger tracks.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: This are just as good as the most expensive ones
customer_reviews.text: Got my Kubota MX5800 tractor out of a super wet field with these. The tractor was stock all the way down to the frame. They did not break or show cracks at all. Saved me a bunch of money. Great thing to have around the farm or in the truck.
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: Self recovery made easy
customer_reviews.text: Girlfriend got me these as a gift, I LOVE THEM! You don't want to be spinning your tires on these pads I imagine that'll melt the plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Victor

customer_reviews.title: these things are sweet
customer_reviews.text: first time out rescued a tacoma stuck on the beach with the tide rolling in. these things are sweet
customer_reviews.author: Vinicius Santana

customer_reviews.title: So easy to connect or use separately
customer_reviews.text: So easy to connect or use separately. I bought two sets and have used four independently in the loose sand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: A poor mans maxtrax I have no complaints. The only thing I do wish is that they stacked alittle better, but I can live with how they sit together. They’re durable and hold up well I’ve even used them in -30 degree weather up in Alaska and I had no problem of cracking.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Walter Stacy

customer_reviews.title: They are the Best
customer_reviews.text: They are the Best. I have been using my first set for years now and just got my second set. my friends have bought the other brands and they have broke. Look them up on Youtube. You can't go wrong. I have bought them for my Company to use, no one has any complaints, just were do I buy them and how much.
customer_reviews.author: James Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: These work just fine. They will get you unstuck in mud. I already have proven it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: They work just fine. Just go easy when using and don't gun ...
customer_reviews.text: Hey! They work just fine. Just go easy when using and don't gun the gas pedal or you will wear down the nubs. You should not be gunning the gas anyway when using these items.
customer_reviews.author: DP

customer_reviews.title: Got me out of a sandy situation
customer_reviews.text: Got to test these out in the Utah desert when I was out by myself in deep sand. Worked flawlessly for my modified 2009 Tacoma. I can’t really say anything about long term durability but will edit my review if any problems arise. Only complaint is I wish these stacked better.
customer_reviews.author: ddmilner

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.text: These things are absolutely a must have. Saved me when I got stuck in some deep snow and was unable to use my winch highly highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Seem very well built
customer_reviews.text: These are great. Haven't put them to a serious test yet, but used them lightly to ramp up over a landscaping timber and they were very solid. I think they are going to be useful to have around.
customer_reviews.author: Dave B.

customer_reviews.title: This should be the first thing you buy when going ...
customer_reviews.text: This should be the first thing you buy when going offroad. I cant say enough about these. I have used them multiple times and they work every time.
customer_reviews.author: Marcin

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought them
customer_reviews.text: So far I have used them 3 times. All to escape the snow. I have not tested the flexibility or its ability to bridge. Glad I bought them.
customer_reviews.author: Adventure_Trac

customer_reviews.title: Literal life savers.
customer_reviews.text: hand down the shiz. These things have saved my arse more than once. Worth every penny. If you spend any time off-road alone you’re irresponsible to not have these with you. If the manufacturers reading this....can we please make stackable.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Yager

customer_reviews.title: Snow help? Meh
customer_reviews.text: Used a few times in the snow and had a few vehicles kick them out the back. Worked ok, but very little bite on the back side in the snow. Have not used in mud or sand but could see them working better in those materials.
customer_reviews.author: GRS

customer_reviews.title: Lacking a little flexibility, making it difficult to get ...
customer_reviews.text: Lacking a little flexibility, making it difficult to get under tire if sunk in mud, but once that's overcome, works as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Rory K. Aikens

customer_reviews.title: Raced in The Baja 500
customer_reviews.text: These where a lifesaver at the Baja 500 when we got stuck in the silt , these got us out several times and will race again with these Ramps for sure .
customer_reviews.author: Rick Nunez

customer_reviews.title: Great for Getting you Unstuck in the Sand
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to take with me when driving my Jeep on the sand at OBX, NC. They are light weight, but very strudy and are perfect for using in the sand when I get stuck. I mounted them to the back bumper below the spare tire, so this saves room in my Jeep.
customer_reviews.author: B. J. Drake

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!!!, bought myself 2 pairs, and my brother 1 pair
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome, I have 2 sets so a total of 4. Saved me in some soft sand dunes (Pismo Dunes) after my front driver hub wouldn't engage 4x4, I was essentially in in 2WD because my passenger side front was just spinning. These are awesome for what they are, but the only problem is you have to go back and pick them up after you get to a "safe" place, which on the dunes there is none really. Luckily my buddy picked them up for me and I just continued to book it so I could get out of the deep, loose sand.
customer_reviews.author: BollyHero

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: These are a must have for anyone out in the sand/ beach. It got us out of problems really easy and we even helped out other people who were stuck. We just put these in front of the rear wheel and slowly accelerated until the tires caught on and kept on going with our driving. P.S. Make sure you dont forget them after you get your car out
customer_reviews.author: Bazukaz

customer_reviews.title: It's what I expected.
customer_reviews.text: Not to heavy, fits well in my sedan trunk and stacks. I found the product well built and wider than most traction mats.
customer_reviews.author: American

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Really happy with these, abused them for a weekend with 7 different trucks and no problems!
customer_reviews.author: Spud

customer_reviews.title: Cheap alternative that gets you buy <_
customer_reviews.text: They will save you. But only once or twice. Melted plastic and cracks after the first used. Helped save the day but I wouldn’t trust more than 1-2 times.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Cannella

customer_reviews.title: Works better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Simple, and works. Works better than expected. Every offroader should have one (two). Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Piotr

customer_reviews.title: Great sturdy product for a affordable price
customer_reviews.text: Great sturdy product for a affordable price! Bought it for my boyfriend and he loves them. Haven’t had to use them yet thankfully but I’m confident they will work with seeing how it’s built!
customer_reviews.author: Tabatha

customer_reviews.title: down side its quite hard to mount to a truck ( best way is to just drill some hols in it ...
customer_reviews.text: helped us out in the dudes when we digged our ford raptor in. down side its quite hard to mount to a truck ( best way is to just drill some hols in it and mount it to the side of somthing.
customer_reviews.author: George Keune

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Good value, good quality, big savings. but, big problem is they don't stack so they take up lots of space and not sure it would be easy to use most mounting options..
customer_reviews.author: S. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Look cool and work better
customer_reviews.text: These boards work just as well as the 300 dollar ones. I’ve bridged gaps with them in my jeep and saved countless rigs from deep sand. Great deal
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Used correctly, they are awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I've read what others have said and I have to say, I agree with the majority, these are great. I used them today to help a GIGANTIC Ford truck stuck in the snow. Even used these to dig the snow away from the tires and put them in. I braced under them with some extra snow so they would flex to much (just got to pay attention to how you use them) and he was able to get out of the snowing grip of that ditch with no issues. He was going to buy a set to store in the back of his truck. I have these, a shovel, and a winch with me at all times.
customer_reviews.author: Mikedave

customer_reviews.title: Did not work as well as I thought they would ...
customer_reviews.text: Did not work as well as I thought they would. I wound up having to use my winch in stead. And I need trapped all the mud inside the base of them. And they really do not stack up very well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: worth it!
customer_reviews.text: these boards are AMAZING. they got an expedition that was stuck in sand half way up the tire, out, no problem. They can be used as a shovel as well. Easy to use. Doesn't show signs of stress bends, would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work at beach Chevy 2500
customer_reviews.text: The plastic is smooth so if ur tires are wet and u don't have traction then these do nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Robert gray

customer_reviews.title: This item is amazing! I ordered them after I got stuck in ...
customer_reviews.text: This item is amazing! I ordered them after I got stuck in the sand all the way up to the frame of my truck. A gentleman pulled over and whipped these out and I was instantly rescued! He informed me that he was stuck in mud up to his fog lights and that the Maxtrax got him out of the mud. These are easy to use and perfect to have on hand for any type of off-roading.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Queen

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Cheaper than MaxTrax but seem to be ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Cheaper than MaxTrax but seem to be as tough. I have a set of MaxTrax AND MaxSA and they both get the job done. Don't be caught in the woods without them!
customer_reviews.author: geohil

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work for me
customer_reviews.text: Tried using it to get my truck out of sand and it didn’t work for me. Waste of money my tires were getting damaged spinning on these plastic pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owned my original set for 3 years, just bought again as I lost one ramp in a snow covered water hole. Too bad they don’t float :)
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: arrived as expected, look kinda faded for being new ...
customer_reviews.text: arrived as expected, look kinda faded for being new. still have to mount, don't stack well but knew that going in and wasn't going to spend over double the price to have stack-ability. will update this review once I have used and see if they fade once mounted.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Galindo

customer_reviews.title: Must Have!
customer_reviews.text: They worked exactly as stated. My friend got stuff in the sand with his 4Runner last week. Luckily I had these with me. We were able to get him out using the tracks. I recommend these if your planning on doing any type of off-roading.
customer_reviews.author: Lennee Bayan Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Totally not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Totally not worth the money, there is no rigidity, I didn’t even have to use it to know that the teeth will melt right off. Save yourself and get the real deal.
customer_reviews.author: Usman Saleem

customer_reviews.title: Great so far!
customer_reviews.text: Used once... but got me out of a deep rut.
customer_reviews.author: T. Menard

customer_reviews.title: Got my truck out of some loose sand. Also ...
customer_reviews.text: Got my truck out of some loose sand. Also works as a temporary ramp for changing oil for low cars.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Warren

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: bought them recently and used them once already, no problem getting out from been stuck, a must for 4-wheelers.
customer_reviews.author: Cristobal B. Espinosa

customer_reviews.title: Top quality
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used them yet, but they look good. Hope I never use them!!
customer_reviews.author: Popeye

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: Bought these a few months ago and have since used them twice in a situation where I had gotten stuck; both were in deep snow and they did their job and held up fine. Definitely happy with my purchase & would buy again
customer_reviews.author: Josh Newland

customer_reviews.title: SWEET!
customer_reviews.text: Already had to use them, so they have some trail dirt on them...SWEET!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Petsche

customer_reviews.title: Dependability
customer_reviews.text: Work extremely well in sand as well as snow at great price you can’t go wrong with the MAXSA Escaper Buddy Traction Mat. They work just as well as the $300+ ones but these are affordable and just as reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Gary T

customer_reviews.title: Good Traction board!
customer_reviews.text: posted a flex review video on Youtube! very durable and a great price point!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Merriman

customer_reviews.title: Tried them and they work like a pro
customer_reviews.text: Beach worthy and off-road worthy. Tried them and they work like a pro. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin T

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Seam tough. Will test them out soon. Hopefully won't need them. Update if I use them.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: No grip at all. Very thick and not stackable at all.
customer_reviews.author: Legalgal

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: My first trip to Pismo Beach, CA and they got used all weekend by me and several other to get us unstuck from the sand....Awesome Product
customer_reviews.author: Erick Manier

customer_reviews.title: threw these bad boys under their tires and they easily were able ...
customer_reviews.text: These worked out so well! We went offroading this weekend in Anza Borrego, and a couple in a subaru got stuck in a mud puddle. They said they had been stuck there for about an hour and had tried shoving rocks under the tire to give it leverage. We pulled over, threw these bad boys under their tires and they easily were able to pull out of the mud. These were the best purchase I have made out of my offroading gear. I feel safe knowing I have these.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love these traction boards. Hope to never need them, but they look great on my truck.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Kind

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! I was able to free two different vehicles ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! I was able to free two different vehicles that were stuck in the sand. Each recovery took less than 5 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: These work well, have gotten us out of a bind several times.
customer_reviews.author: SMR

customer_reviews.title: Nice alternative without breaking the bank.
customer_reviews.text: A nice cost effective alternative to MaxTrax. These seem well built and although I have not used them yet I have confidence that they won't fall apart after the first use.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: I used this to get some people out of deep ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this to get some people out of deep packed snow. When they slowly moved over the traction, they got unstuck fast.
customer_reviews.author: John Oh

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: Jet skis being towed on a rear wheel drive truck and got out of a sticky situation. Worked well in sand.
customer_reviews.author: DTran

customer_reviews.title: They work.
customer_reviews.text: They work. Just came from a beach trip on my Wrangler. Had a real chance to use them on the sand. Are they Maxtrax knockoffs? Sure looks like it. Are Maxtrax better? Probably. If I was living in the outbacks, I'd probably invest in the Maxtrax. But for an occasional ride off the roads (me), these will do.
customer_reviews.author: agiosKatastrof

customer_reviews.title: The Best Option where cost and performance intersect.
customer_reviews.text: These are the best of the options where cost and performance cross. I considered the lower and higher priced options and went with these. They work great. If I needed them every day as part of my business, I'd go with the Max Trax. But I can buy four to six of these MAXSA mats for the price of the Australian plastic. They do stack thickly but on the roof, who cares. They make a fine makeshift stretcher, you know, just in case.
customer_reviews.author: Tripwire

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for less
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality at 1/2 the $ of the other ones
customer_reviews.author: Kevlarr

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product and i use it for off-road stuck situations and it wows me! Overall 5 star!
customer_reviews.author: ahmad zulfadly

product_meta.title: MAXSA 20333 Escaper Buddy Traction Mats for Off-Road Mud, Sand, & Snow Vehicle Extraction (Set of 2), Orange
product_meta.description: Color:Orange| Size:StandardThe Escaper Buddy Tracks from MAXSA Innovations has raised tracks to give your vehicle the maximum grip necessary to get out of any tough spot. Snow, mud, dirt or sand cannot stand up to the traction provided by the Escaper buddy. Press lightly on the accelerator and youre going again. No towing and no pushing. This product is made of high-impact polypropylene and comes as a set of 2. They are lightweight, but extremely durable. Keep a set in every vehicle you own and never get stuck again.
feature_bullets: 2 Pack, Each traction mat is 48 inches long and 14.5 inches wide
Raised tracks help prevent vehicle tires from spinning on snow, ice, mud or sand
Ideal for off-road use to help spinning tires get traction in the elements
Lightweight, Durable, High-impact Polypropylene plastic construction make these built to last

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars331 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
